Stronger Than Pride is the third studio album by the English 
group Sade. It was released in the United Kingdom on 14 May 1988 
and in the United States on 7 June 1988 by Epic Records.

Sade are a British R&B band formed in London in 1983, although 
three of its members were born in Kingston upon Hull. The band 
was named after their lead singer Sade Adu. Its music features 
elements of R&B, soul, jazz, and soft rock.

Sade's debut album, Diamond Life, was released in 1984, reaching 
No. 2 in the UK Album Chart, selling over 1.2 million copies in 
the UK, and won the Brit Award for Best British Album in 1985 
The album was also a hit internationally, reaching No. 1 in 
several countries and the top ten in the US where it has sold in 
excess of 4 million copies. In late 1985, Sade released its second 
album, Promise, which peaked at No. 1 in both the UK and the US
It was certified double platinum in the UK, and quadruple platinum 
in the US. In 1986 the band won a Grammy Award for Best New Artist 
Sade's sixth studio album, Soldier of Love, was released worldwide 
on 8 February 2010, and peaked at No. 4 in the UK, and No. 1 in 
the US. In 2011, the band won its fourth Grammy Award for Best R&B 
Performance by a Duo or Group with Vocals
